It is thought that American height dominance

Some believe that the great strides in height
made by Western Europeans over Americans can

262.text:
be attributed to their universal health coverage
and other social policies, such as maternity

268.text:
services and greater parental leave allowing
for better practicality of things like breastfeeding

273.text:
vs. formula fed and, later, more time off
work providing extra time for preparing nutritious

278.text:
meals, rather than relying on fast-food and
other quick high-calorie, low nutrition “junk”

283.text:
foods. Further, the so-called “over-nutrition”
prevalent in the U.S., combined with lack

288.text:
of physical activity leading to widespread
obesity, has also been noted for its negative

292.text:
effects on growth hormones and metabolism,
limiting the ultimate adult height somewhat.

298.text:
So how high will humans grow with perfect
nutrition and health care? It’s generally

302.text:
thought the Dutch are close to the peak of
average human height potential, at least based

307.text:
on innate genetics, and Americans and others
are close to it. This is probably a good thing

312.text:
as the human body is not adapted well for
extreme height, and those outliers who do

317.text:
